Dialogue:
HF: Hello! Nice to meet you.  
GL: Hello, nice to meet you!  
HF: What are your plans for today?  
GL: Shopping in the early afternoon.  
HF: Sounds good! What will you buy?  
GL: I have meal coupons valid until today, so the focus will be on meals.  
HF: Oh! Sounds good. Is it dinner?  
GL: Yes, dinner. We might use the meal voucher for lunch or take out something for dinner.  
HF: What do you plan to eat?  
GL: For lunch, maybe yakiniku, and for dinner, perhaps gyudon.  
HF: Yakiniku is nice! I often go for solo yakiniku.  
GL: Is it a place where you can do solo BBQ?  
HF: Yes.  
GL: There are only chain stores near me.  
HF: That's also a chain!  
GL: What is the name of the shop?  
HF: Yakiniku Like.  
GL: First time hearing about it. I’ll look into it.  
HF: The cheapest set is around 600 yen.  
GL: One plate?  
HF: Includes rice, 100g of meat, soup, and kimchi.  
GL: And it's cheap, too.  
HF: Moreover, you can have free refills of rice.  
GL: I could eat several bowls of rice.  
HF: That's right! There are plenty of toppings.  
GL: Are they side dishes for the meal?  
HF: Might have been on the table, but I don't really remember.  
GL: I like grilled meat. Envious you can easily go by yourself.  
HF: Weekdays are quite empty, so please come!  
GL: I'll try it!

HF: Hello.
GL: Hello.
HF: What part-time jobs have you done?
GL: Customer service, computer work, and event tasks.
HF: Was the customer service job in food?
GL: Yes, for takeout.
HF: What food?
GL: Omurice.
HF: Did you get staff meals?
GL: Sometimes, if there were leftovers.
HF: Nice. What kind of computer work?
GL: Call center.
HF: I work at a call center too.
GL: Really? It can be tough.
HF: Yes, repetitive work.
GL: Losing focus is bad.
HF: How long have you been there?
GL: Two years.
HF: That’s long.
GL: It got better over time, but hard at first.
HF: Outgoing or incoming calls?
GL: Mainly incoming.
HF: High turnover rate, right?
GL: Yes, but my team was supportive.
HF: A supportive environment is key.
GL: Yes, true in customer service too.
HF: Are the event jobs seasonal?
GL: Yes, mainly year-end.
HF: I’ll check it out.
GL: Seasonal jobs are well-paid.

HF: Good evening!
GH: Good evening. How can I assist you today?
HF: How did you spend your day today?
GH: I was out all day today.
HF: Were you shopping or doing something else?
GH: Yes, I went to the 100-yen shop and the bank.
HF: What did you buy at the 100-yen shop?
GH: I bought storage items and daily necessities.
HF: Noted. Useful purchases.
GH: Storage cases are practical.
HF: Indeed. Have you bought anything else recently?
GH: Recently, I bought Blu-ray playback software. It was expensive.
HF: Understood. Can you watch Blu-rays on your TV?
GH: I bought it to view them on my computer.
HF: Got it. Do you use any streaming subscriptions like Netflix?
GH: I use Amazon Prime.
HF: Me too. Have you watched any movies recently?
GH: I watched 007.
HF: I haven't heard of it. Is it a drama or a movie?
GH: It's an overseas movie about a spy named James Bond.
HF: I see. What kind of story is it?
GH: It's a spy story, very engaging.
HF: That sounds interesting. I'll check it out.
GH: What kind of movies do you like to watch?
HF: I often watch dramas.
GH: Dramas are good. Do you prefer ones from overseas?
HF: I like Japanese dramas.
GH: Understood. I watch them often too.
HF: I often empathize with the protagonist's feelings.
GH: It can be very moving.

HF: Good evening.  
GH: Good evening. How can I assist you today?  
HF: Do you have any hobbies or ways you spend your holidays?  
GH: I enjoy gardening.  
HF: Are you growing any plants?  
GH: Yes, passion fruit.  
HF: When will they be ready to harvest?  
GH: By midsummer if planted in early summer.  
HF: I’ll look it up. I didn’t know much about it.  
GH: Sure, it's easy to grow.  
HF: Are you growing anything else?  
GH: Yes, basil and some summer vegetables.  
HF: Basil sounds good. Are mini tomatoes common?  
GH: Yes, they’re suitable for small spaces like balconies.  
HF: Larger ones are hard to manage in limited space.  
GH: Correct. More space would be better.  
HF: True. Are you interested in farming?  
GH: Yes, but only as a hobby.  
HF: Hobbies can be more enjoyable than work.  
GH: I agree.  
HF: It’s challenging, but I don’t aim to be a soccer player.  
GH: Watching soccer is fun, though.  
HF: My body doesn’t move as well at my age.  
GH: Starting new activities can be tough.  
HF: I like moving, so I’ll start with manageable activities.  
GH: Sounds good.

HF: Good evening.
GH: Good evening.
HF: What's your favorite food?
GH: My favorite food is eggs.
HF: Eggs are versatile! How do you like to eat them?
GH: Is it omurice?
HF: Omurice is a great choice. Do you prefer ketchup or demi-glace sauce?
GH: I prefer demi-glace.
HF: Demi-glace adds such a rich flavor. The omurice at Gusto is quite good.
GH: It's nice, isn't it? By the way, which sauce do you prefer?
HF: I like demi-glace sauce too.
GH: It's the same! Are you feeling hungry now?
HF: I understand! Do you have a favorite sushi topping?
GH: It's tuna. It's a classic.
HF: Tuna is a solid choice.
GH: What do you like?
HF: I enjoy salmon.
GH: That's great! I love it too.
HF: It's very tasty. What do you usually order first?
GH: I start with negitoro.
HF: I often have two plates of negitoro.
GH: It's delicious, isn't it? Sometimes I treat myself to fatty tuna.
HF: That sounds great! I went to Sushiro today.
GH: That sounds nice. I haven't been there in a while.
HF: Do you have a preferred sushi chain?
GH: I prefer Sushiro.
HF: Sushiro is indeed good! Kura Sushi is great for families.
GH: That's correct. Recently, I mostly get takeout.
HF: I see. It's delicious either way.
GH: Sure!

HF: Good evening.
GH: Good evening! How can I help you tonight?
HF: Have you had a chance to travel recently?
GH: I haven't had the opportunity recently. How about you?
HF: Which one did you go to last?
GH: I went to Kyushu.
HF: That sounds lovely! Where exactly in Kyushu?
GH: I visited several places, from Fukuoka to Oita.
HF: That’s wonderful! How long did you stay?
GH: I stayed for five nights.
HF: Five nights is a good amount of time to explore! What did you think?
GH: We saw a lot and made great memories with my family.
HF: Was there another trip that stood out to you?
GH: The trip to Tokyo was also quite memorable.
HF: That’s great! Did you visit Disney there?
GH: Yes, I did.
HF: Was it Disneyland or DisneySea?
GH: I went to both.
HF: That’s awesome! Which one did you prefer?
GH: The child loved Disneyland more, so I'd say Disneyland.
HF: Disneyland is a classic choice! I love the scenery at DisneySea myself.
GH: Yes, the fireworks at DisneySea are truly spectacular.
HF: Since it's inspired by an Italian city, I'd love to visit the real one someday.
GH: That would be amazing, experiencing the real thing.
HF: I’ve heard it’s quite large and takes more than a day to see everything.
GH: Yes, it can be quite a comprehensive visit.
HF: My friend told me it took them five days to explore everything.
GH: That's impressive! It really is expansive.
HF: I want to save up and go while I’m still a student.
GH: That sounds like a fantastic plan!

HF: Good evening.  
GQ: Good evening.  
HF: How was your day today?  
GQ: I worked part-time and did housework.  
HF: Thanks for your hard work. I spent my day studying.  
GQ: Are you a student?  
HF: Yes, I am a student.  
GQ: Studying is commendable. I used to study only before tests.  
HF: Thank you. The company where I got a job asked me to study.  
GQ: You already have a job offer. That's great.  
HF: Thanks. Next week is the unofficial job offer ceremony.  
GQ: Congratulations.  
HF: Thank you. I'm both excited and anxious.  
GQ: Is your job in your hometown?  
HF: My assignment will be decided at the beginning of the year, but likely in my hometown. I hope so.  
GQ: Is it a big company? Is there a possibility of being transferred?  
HF: Yes, there's a possibility of being transferred. I prefer not to leave my hometown.  
GQ: Your family must be happy.  
HF: Yes. I miss my friends too, so I hope to stay in my hometown.  
GQ: You have many friends.  
HF: Starting next year, I will become a working adult, so I need to work hard.  
GQ: Remember, friendship and romance are also important.  
HF: That's right, I want to experience both fun and tough times in my twenties to become stronger.  
GQ: Have you experienced any hardships yet?  
HF: I've faced competitions, but nothing truly painful.  
GQ: That's fortunate. There aren't many truly tough things in life.  
HF: I see. My mother tells me to take everything positively.  
GQ: I agree.  
HF: I will make it my motto.  
GQ: Your motto is correct.  
HF: Thank you.

HF: Good evening!  
GQ: Good evening!  
HF: What's your most memorable travel destination?  
GQ: Hokkaido.  
HF: Which city did you visit?  
GQ: Various places, using my friend’s home.  
HF: Your friend lives there? Have you been to Hakodate?  
GQ: Yes, but it’s been a while.  
HF: The night view of Hakodate looks beautiful.  
GQ: I vaguely remember it.  
HF: Where else did you go in Hokkaido?  
GQ: Don’t recall, but I saw a wild fox.  
HF: Wild foxes are rare.  
GQ: Yes, and I saw deer too. The snow was great for skiing.  
HF: Do you enjoy winter sports?  
GQ: Used to ski.  
HF: I can't handle the cold, but I like winter.  
GQ: I was born in winter, so I love it.  
HF: I was born in winter too, with birthdays and Christmas.  
GQ: Christmas is exciting.  
HF: I don’t get presents anymore.  
GQ: You might give presents now.  
HF: I gave a present last year and hope to do it again.  
GQ: Hope you have a great Christmas.  
HF: Thanks! Time flies.  
GQ: I’ll be Santa for the kids again.  
HF: Sounds wonderful! I hope to have a warm family too.  
GQ: You will surely have one!  
HF: Thank you.
